title: Mulholland Drive font.
content:
Hello!

I'd like to know what this font is, or what font looks like it.

Thanks for everything!

Chris.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150426204524im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_4187.jpg)
author: krissserz

comments.content: It's very similar to [B-52](http://web.archive.org/web/20150426204524/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stockbucket/b-52/), or [Diamante Medium,](http://web.archive.org/web/20150426204524/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/diamante/) but the "M" is different.

[Bombardier](http://web.archive.org/web/20150426204524/http:/www.dafont.com/bombardier.font?nb_ppp=50&text=MULHOLLAND+DR) from Apostrophic Labs is fairly similar, but the M crotch isn't pointed and reaching the baseline. [MVB Solano Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150426204524/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/solano-gothic/bold/) is also similar, but has the angles rounded out. The M, unfortunately, is more like Bombardier than your sample.

- Mike Yanega

Great!

Thanks to everyone looking... We're getting there!

I'm almost done looking through all of my 2006 FontBook... No luck so far.

Chris!
[Foundry Gridnik](http://web.archive.org/web/20150426204524/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/foundry_gridnik/gridnik_bold.html) is similar, but the font is too wide...
